intro: Mezoneuron rubrum, commonly known as the red-stemmed mezoneuron, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its striking red stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Mezoneuron rubrum is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
